author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Bucs' Anthony Walker Jr. Fires Back at Critics: Aiming to Boost Pass Defense
text:
Bucs’ Anthony Walker Jr. Fires Back at Critics: Aiming to Boost Pass Defense
New Bucs inside linebacker Anthony Walker Jr. aims to elevate a struggling Tampa Bay defense, particularly in pass coverage. He values the role of the Mike linebacker, equating it to being the “quarterback” of the defense, and is determined to embrace whatever responsibilities that entails. Walker has a unique perspective on the game, drawing from his experiences as a defensive back and even a quarterback, which shapes his understanding of offensive strategies. He boasts four career interceptions and 21 pass breakups over eight seasons, hoping to leverage that expertise for the Bucs this season.
- Walker has a Pro Football Focus pass defense grade of 39.1.
- He recorded a run-stopping grade of 69.5 in his career.
- Walker is adjusting to a new environment with expectations to improve Tampa Bay's pass defense.
- He has publicly addressed criticisms regarding his performance on social media, urging critics to review game tape for better insights.
As the season approaches, Walker's performance will be closely monitored, particularly in improving his pass coverage stats. If he can turn criticisms into motivation, he could play a fundamental role in revitalizing the Buccaneers’ defense.
Bottom LineWalker Jr. embodies a proactive mindset and depth of experience that could significantly bolster Tampa Bay's defensive unit. If he delivers on his promises, the Bucs could witness marked improvements in their pass coverage this year.
Read more at Pewter Report
